title: Designing Digital-Enhanced Pedagogy for K-12 Computer Science Education in Mongolia

context.prior_knowledge: Basic computer literacy and foundational computer science knowledge at the secondary education level
context.additional_context: A course exploring digital-enhanced computer science curriculum design applicable to Mongolia’s K-12 education system. Includes students and job seekers as learner roles, aiming to strengthen 21st-century competencies linked to social studies.

learning_goals: Deriving educational design plans reflecting 21st-century competencies (problem-solving, collaboration, digital literacy) through analysis of Mongolia’s K-12 computer science curriculum.
Developing a prototype for digital-enhanced pedagogy tailored to Mongolia’s educational environment using simulation/VR tools.
Identifying cultural and technical challenges that may arise during curriculum design through project-based assessments and proposing solutions.

resources: Mongolian K-12 Computer Science Curriculum Documents

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
